textBeforeTable: The array of services available under the Consolidated Schedule includes: It is also appealing to industry, as it enables them to offer their entire business line under a single Schedule contract versus marketing and administering multiple individual Schedules. The Consolidated Schedule is particularly appealing to federal agencies when procuring requirements that fall under various functional domains. For example, a federal agency can use the Consolidated Schedule to issue a task order to a single company to perform a requirement that includes services falling within the scope of multiple Schedules. The Consolidated Schedule encompasses the vast majority of services currently offered under GSA's Schedules program. In fact, the Consolidated Schedule is basically a roll up of some of the individual Schedules maintained by various Acquisition Centers. GSA Consolidated Schedule - Schedule 00CORP Training Services, Aids, & Devices Scientific Equipment and Services Publication Media - Schedule 76 Professional Engineering Services (PES) Logistics (LOGWORLD) Language Services HR & Administrative Services Financial & Accounting Services Contact Center Services Consumer Outreach & Publication Services Solicitation (Consolidated) Professional Services Schedule Modification Instructions (Consolidated) FAQs Potential Schedule
textAfterTable: Federal agencies award consolidated task orders following the Schedule ordering procedures outlined in FAR 8.4 and the Supplemental Ordering Procedures for Services (requiring a Statement of Work).
